result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Beaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If imposed, the defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. If revoked, to be served consecutive to sentence on case 20CF424. STAYED for probation.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. Not to use or possess any CBD products/oils.
No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Matthew D Beaver in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

FELONY WARNING PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
Consecutive to:  20CF424
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to:  Any other probation
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Not to use or possess any CBD products/oils.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Not to use or possess any dangerous weapon.


COSTS:  $ 268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

10:48 AM Defendant Matthew D Beaver in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Broze states the defendant is currently set for sentencing on his other matter on March 11, 2022 and requests this matter be set for a status of preliminary hearing on that date for a potential waiver.  Preliminary time limits waived.  If matter needs to be set for a preliminary hearing, it may be set back before Commissioner Court.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Court will refund the cash bail posted on 22CF283 to the poster..

02:32 PM Defendant Matthew D Beaver in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
